title.narrative: Afghanistan food safety and sanitary and phytosanitary initiative

description.narrative: 1. In 2018, UNIDO has commenced negotiations with the World Bank Group (WBG) to build a solid partnership and integrate its technical knowledge and expertise in WBG#s investment portfolio. 2. As a result of the mission by UNIDO delegation to Washington in September 2018, the two organizations have agreed on priority countries and sectors for agribusiness cooperation, including food safety capacity building in Afghanistan as one of the pilots for this collaboration. 3. As per the negotiations between UNIDO and WBG, UNIDO's assistance was requested to design a project on agro-industrial parks which after some initial negotiations shifted to food safety and SPS Capacity building after UNIDO's field visit in November 2018. 4. This change was due to the needs of new US$175 million World Bank grant being developed for Afghanistan which holds the title of Opportunity for Maximizing Agribusiness Investments and Development; 5. UNIDO has maintained continuous engagement with WBG as well as the Government of Afghanistan on this project and UNIDO experts are invited to Afghanistan in November 2019 to finalize the required project document for the Government of Afghanistan.
